note.value: About 52 lines, corresponding to three sides of text (one folio + one side), of the Jaeger edition are missing between 271.16 (fol. 176v) and 274.2 (fol. 182r). About 39 lines, corresponding to one folio, of the Jaeger edition are missing between 281.13 (fol. 171r) and 283.6 (fol. 177r); these correspond to two sides (one folio) of text. These gaps coincide with a lost bifolio (the second in the quire, if this was a quaternio) and a lost page (the unreadable side of fol. 182 = pastedown); the original quaternio can be reconstructed as follows: I (176rv), II (fol. lost), III (recto unreadable, verso = pastedown/182r), IV (181vr), V (172vr), VI (171vr), VII (fol. lost), VIII (177rv)

Bibliography: W. Jaeger (ed.), Two rediscovered works of ancient Christian literature: Gregory of Nyssa and Macarius (Leiden, 1954) ; A. Hjelt (ed.), Syrus sinaiticus (Helsingfors, 1930), p. 15 ; S. J. Voicu, Frammenti di un palinsesto greco di Efrem (Sinaiticus Syr. 30, f. 171ff.), Scriptorium 38 (1984), pp. 77-78
